body.raw:
Is your brand truly distinctive? Or just another face in the crowd?

Many brands struggle to carve out a unique space in their market. Your brand’s unique value proposition should be a shining beacon, not a distant glimmer.

Our diagnostic tool measures how well your brand establishes a unique emotional connection maintains consistency across all touchpoints, and adapts to market changes—all the while staying true to its core identity.

Dare to find out the truth with our Distinctive Brand Index assessment. The results might surprise you!

Take the Assessment

seo.title: Sustainability Statement
seo.description: At Polything, we believe that responsible marketing is not just about promoting products and services—it s about

body.raw:
At Polything, we believe that responsible marketing is not just about promoting products and services—it’s about fostering a sustainable future for our planet. As a marketing consultancy, we are acutely aware of the environmental impacts associated with our industry. That’s why we are committed to mitigating these effects and raising awareness among our clients about what sustainable growth truly means in marketing.

Our Commitment to Environmental Sustainability

  • Current Footprint: Our estimated annual carbon footprint is 1.67 tonnes of CO₂e per employee, totalling 3.33 tonnes for our entire company. This is 60% lower than the industry average, but we recognise there’s more work to be done. For information on how this has been calculated please visit Small99.
  • Actions Taken:
    • Switched to Renewable Energy: We have moved to Ecotricity as our energy supplier, ensuring that our operations are powered by 100% renewable sources.
    • Implemented Energy-Efficient Lighting: We’ve conducted an audit of our lighting systems and replaced all non-LED lights with energy-efficient LEDs to reduce energy consumption.
    • Home Energy Initiatives: For our team members working from home, we’ve encouraged and facilitated the switch to renewable energy suppliers.
  • Ongoing Efforts:
    • Measuring Our Carbon Footprint: We’re utilising tools like Sage Earth and Clean Growth UK to accurately measure and monitor our emissions.
    • Supply Chain Evaluation: We’re exporting supply chain data to understand the environmental impact of our top suppliers.

Future Goals

  • Carbon Negative by 2030: We aim to not just offset but exceed our carbon emissions, making us carbon negative.
  • Continuous Improvement: We’re exploring innovative solutions for carbon reduction and investing in technologies that support our sustainability objectives.

Social Responsibility

  • Client Advocacy: We’re proactively engaging with our clients to discuss their sustainability agendas, encouraging them to measure their carbon footprints and adopt renewable energy solutions.
  • Team Engagement: Our team is our greatest asset. We hold monthly meetings to share progress, brainstorm ideas, and ensure everyone contributes to our sustainability journey.
  • Community Involvement: We’re exploring opportunities for volunteering and charitable donations to support environmental causes within our community.

Supply Chain Management

  • Sustainable Partnerships: We prioritise working with suppliers who share our commitment to sustainability. For instance, we use Google Workspace, which is striving for net-zero emissions and 24/7 carbon-free energy operations by 2030.
  • Supplier Support: We engage with our suppliers to understand their sustainability practices and offer support to align their efforts with our goals.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Open Communication: We maintain transparent communication with our employees, clients, and other stakeholders about our sustainability initiatives.
  • Collaborative Efforts: Feedback and collaboration are encouraged to enhance our ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) strategies.

Join Us on Our Journey

Sustainability is a collective effort. We invite our clients, partners, and community to join us in redefining sustainable growth in marketing. Together, we can make a meaningful impact on the environment while driving success for our businesses.

Contact Us

For more information about our sustainability initiatives or to collaborate with us on environmentally responsible marketing strategies, please get in touch.

seo.title: Terms and Conditions
seo.description: Terms and Conditions Welcome to Polything. These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for

body.raw:
Terms and Conditions

Welcome to Polything.

These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of Polything Ltd’s Website, located at https://polything.co.uk.

By accessing this website we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not continue to use Polything if you do not agree to take all of the terms and conditions stated on this page.

The following terminology applies to these Terms and Conditions, Privacy Statement and Disclaimer Notice and all Agreements: “Client”, “You” and “Your” refers to you, the person log on this website and is compliant with the Company’s terms and conditions. “The Company”, “Ourselves”, “We”, “Our” and “Us”, refers to our Company. “Party”, “Parties”, or “Us”, refers to both the Client and ourselves. All terms refer to the offer, acceptance and consideration of payment necessary to undertake the process of our assistance to the Client in the most appropriate manner for the express purpose of meeting the Client’s needs in respect of the provision of the Company’s stated services, in accordance with and subject to, prevailing law of Netherlands. Any use of the above terminology or other words in the singular, plural, capitalization and/or he/she or they, are taken as interchangeable and therefore as referring to the same.

Cookies

We employ the use of cookies. By accessing Polything, you agreed to use cookies in agreement with Polything Ltd’s Privacy Policy.

Most interactive websites use cookies to let us retrieve the user’s details for each visit. Cookies are used by our website to enable the functionality of certain areas to make it easier for people visiting our website. Some of our affiliate/advertising partners may also use cookies.

License

Unless otherwise stated, Polything Ltd and/or its licensors own the intellectual property rights for all material on Website Name. All intellectual property rights are reserved. You may access this from Polything for your own personal use subjected to restrictions set in these terms and conditions.

You must not:

  • Republish material from Website Name
  • Sell, rent or sub-license material from Website Name
  • Reproduce, duplicate or copy material from Website Name
  • Redistribute content from Website Name

This Agreement shall begin on the date hereof.

Parts of this website offer an opportunity for users to post and exchange opinions and information in certain areas of the website. Polything Ltd does not filter, edit, publish or review Comments prior to their presence on the website. Comments do not reflect the views and opinions of Polything Ltd, its agents and/or affiliates. Comments reflect the views and opinions of the person who posts their views and opinions. To the extent permitted by applicable laws, Polything Ltd shall not be liable for the Comments or for any liability, damages or expenses caused and/or suffered as a result of any use of and/or posting of and/or appearance of the Comments on this website.

Polything Ltd reserves the right to monitor all Comments and to remove any Comments which can be considered inappropriate, offensive or causes a breach of these Terms and Conditions.

You warrant and represent that:

  • You are entitled to post the Comments on our website and have all necessary licenses and consents to do so;
  • The Comments do not invade any intellectual property right, including without limitation copyright, patent or trademark of any third party;
  • The Comments do not contain any defamatory, libellous, offensive, indecent or otherwise unlawful material which is an invasion of privacy
  • The Comments will not be used to solicit or promote business or custom or present commercial activities or unlawful activity.

You hereby grant Polything Ltd a non-exclusive license to use, reproduce, edit and authorize others to use, reproduce and edit any of your Comments in any and all forms, formats or media.

Hyperlinking to our Content

The following organizations may link to our Website without prior written approval:

  • Government agencies;
  • Search engines;
  • News organizations;
  • Online directory distributors may link to our Website in the same manner as they hyperlink to the Websites of other listed businesses; and
  • System-wide Accredited Businesses except soliciting non-profit organizations, charity shopping malls, and charity fundraising groups which may not hyperlink to our Web site.

These organizations may link to our home page, to publications or to other Website information so long as the link: (a) is not in any way deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship, endorsement or approval of the linking party and its products and/or services; and (c) fits within the context of the linking party’s site.

We may consider and approve other link requests from the following types of organizations:

  • commonly-known consumer and/or business information sources;
  • dot.com community sites;
  • associations or other groups representing charities;
  • online directory distributors;
  • internet portals;
  • accounting, law and consulting firms; and
  • educational institutions and trade associations.

We will approve link requests from these organizations if we decide that: (a) the link would not make us look unfavourably to ourselves or to our accredited businesses; (b) the organization does not have any negative records with us; (c) the benefit to us from the visibility of the hyperlink compensates the absence of Polything Ltd, and (d) the link is in the context of general resource information.

These organizations may link to our home page so long as the link: (a) is not in any way deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship, endorsement or approval of the linking party and its products or services; and (c) fits within the context of the linking party’s site.

If you are one of the organizations listed in paragraph 2 above and are interested in linking to our website, you must inform us by sending an e-mail to Polything Ltd. Please include your name, your organization name, contact information as well as the URL of your site, a list of any URLs from which you intend to link to our Website, and a list of the URLs on our site to which you would like to link. Wait 4 weeks for a response.

Approved organizations may hyperlink to our Website as follows:

  • By use of our corporate name; or
  • By use of the uniform resource locator being linked to; or
  • By use of any other description of our Website being linked to that makes sense within the context and format of content on the linking party’s site.

No use of Polything’s logo or other artwork will be allowed for linking absent a trademark license agreement.

iFrames

Without prior approval and written permission, you may not create frames around our Webpages that alter in any way the visual presentation or appearance of our Website.

Content Liability

We shall not be held responsible for any content that appears on your Website. You agree to protect and defend us against all claims that are rising on your Website. No link(s) should appear on any Website that may be interpreted as libellous, obscene or criminal, or which infringes, otherwise violates, or advocates the infringement or other violation of, any third party rights.

Reservation of Rights

We reserve the right to request that you remove all links or any particular link to our Website. You approve to immediately remove all links to our Website upon request. We also reserve the right to amend these terms and conditions and its linking policy at any time. By continuously linking to our Website, you agree to be bound to and follow these linking terms and conditions.

Removal of links from our website

If you find any link on our Website that is offensive for any reason, you are free to contact and inform us at any moment. We will consider requests to remove links but we are not obligated to or so or to respond to you directly.

We do not ensure that the information on this website is correct, we do not warrant its completeness or accuracy; nor do we promise to ensure that the website remains available or that the material on the website is kept up to date.

Disclaimer

To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, we exclude all representations, warranties and conditions relating to our website and the use of this website. Nothing in this disclaimer will:

  • limit or exclude our or your liability for death or personal injury;
  • limit or exclude our or your liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation;
  • limit any of our or your liabilities in any way that is not permitted under applicable law; or
  • exclude any of our or your liabilities that may not be excluded under applicable law.

The limitations and prohibitions of liability set in this Section and elsewhere in this disclaimer: (a) are subject to the preceding paragraph; and (b) govern all liabilities arising under the disclaimer, including liabilities arising in contract, in tort and for breach of statutory duty.

As long as the website and the information and services on the website are provided free of charge, we will not be liable for any loss or damage of any nature.

seo.title: The Marketing Brief
seo.description: The Marketing Brief Your guide for useful advice and information

body.raw:
The Marketing Brief

Your guide for useful advice and information

seo.title: Value by Design™ (Lite Edition)
seo.description: You’ve just invested in clarity — and we’re thrilled to have you here. Welcome to

body.raw:
You’ve just invested in clarity — and we’re thrilled to have you here.

Welcome to the Value by Design™ programme, a step-by-step journey that turns the swirl of ideas in your head into a value story your customers, investors, and team can rally behind. You’ve said “yes” to sharper messaging, faster decisions, and a brand that feels unmistakably you — smart move.

What happens next

  1. Discover – a quick voice interview (Stage 1) captures the heart of your customers’ pains and gains.
  2. Define – a follow-up product chat maps every feature to those real-world needs.
  3. Distil – our AI analysts cross-check both canvases and surface the gold.
  4. Decide – in the Fit Workshop you’ll lock the strongest pain-reliever / gain-creator pairs and craft a punch-perfect value proposition.

Why you’re in good hands

  • Warm, collaborative approach – we guide, you steer. No jargon, no pressure.
  • Story-driven strategy – every insight ladders up to a narrative that moves people.
  • Practical outcomes – PDFs, talking points, and priority maps you can action the same day.

How to get the most from today

  • Set aside 10 quiet minutes before you hit “Start” on Stage 1. Jot a one-line description of what you do and the top three headaches you solve.
  • Speak naturally during the interview – real words beat polished slogans every time.
  • Trust the process – each step flows into the next, and we’ll nudge you when it’s time to move on.

Ready to begin? Scroll down and press “Start Your Interview”. We’ll do the heavy lifting; you focus on telling the story only you can tell.

We’re excited to hear it.

Start Now
